com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.suppli: §6 Bienvenido a Minecolonies. Ahora que tienes tus recursos, ¿qué te parecería encontrar un buen sitio para colocar tu ayuntamiento y empezar tu colonia? Intenta que esté lejos de una aldea, si es posible.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.colony: §6 Se habla acerca de una nueva colonia. Muy pronto, los primeros colonos se unirán a tu nueva colonia si hay espacio suficiente alrededor del ayuntamiento. (Los administradores con experiencia pueden desactivar estos útiles mensajes en el bloque del ayuntamiento).
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.first_: §6 El primer colono ha llegado. Deberías colocar una choza de constructor para comenzar tu asentamiento.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.builde: §6 ¡Buen trabajo colocando la choza! Sin embargo, no hemos acabado. Necesitas acceder a la interfaz y hacer click en el botón de "construir". Enseguida, tu trabajador estará construyendo edificios para ti.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.built_: §6 Mientras tu constructor trabaja, puedes comprobar los recursos que necesita en la segunda página de la interfaz de construcción.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.builde: §6 Con la choza del constructor terminada deberíamos centrarnos en la producción de recursos. Te recomiendo que consigas un leñador o un minero. Después, construye una taberna para alojar a tus ciudadanos.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.resour: §6 Producir recursos es muy cansino y vuelve hambrientos a tus trabajadores. Quizá quieras construir una granja o una cabaña de pescador.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.food_p: §6 ¡Tu ciudad está creciendo! Para aumentar la eficiencia, quizá desees mejorar los edificios.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.four_c: §6 Todos tus colonos iniciales tienen trabajo ahora. Para conseguir más colonos, tienes que construir o mejorar sus alojamientos.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.all_ci: §6 veo que todos tus habitantes tienen una buen alojamiento ¡Construye mas casas para conseguir mas habitantes!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.four_c: §6 El último ciudadano inicial ha llegado a tu colonia, para conseguir niños construye una choza de ciudadano y asigna un hombre y una mujer.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.seven_: §6 Un nuevo colono ha llegado a tu colonia, y habla acerca de espías bárbaros que han encontrado la incipiente aldea. ¡Quizá sea buena idea construir una torre de guardia!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.six_ci: §6 Un asentamiento creciente conlleva una responsabilidad creciente. Deberías pensar en construir un restaurante para mantener a tu gente alimentada.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.eight_: §6 Tus ciudadanos te ruegan que construyas un almacén. Ello te quitará trabajo, y además podrán conseguir sus recursos más rápido.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.wareho: §6 Has construido un almacén. Sin embargo, tu gente está demasiado ocupada para llenarlo. Construye algunas chozas de repartidores y contrata alguno. Pueden trabajar hasta 5 en cada almacén.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.nine_c: §6 Las habilidades de los colonos influencian la velocidad a la que se vuelven más hábiles. Puedes contratarlos manualmente si lo has configurado en la interfaz del ayuntamiento. Las mejores habilidades para cada trabajo se mostrarán resaltadas durante el proceso de contratación.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.manual: §6 Tus trabajadores se quejan de los largos viajes hasta sus trabajos. Puedes asignarles manualmente a las casas si lo has configurado así en la interfaz del ayuntamiento.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.ten_ci: §6 Una colonia en expansión aumenta la carga sobre tus ciudadanos. Te recomiendo que mejores tus chozas de constructor.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.twenty: §6 Un espía bárbaro ha sido capturado cerca de tu colonia, y parece pertenecer a un grupo mayor. Deberías construir un cuartel para defender tu colonia.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.not_en: §6 Tener mas casas que trabajos disponibles tiene una mala influencia en la felicidad de tu gente.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.newchi: §6 ¡Un nuevo niño vive felizmente entre tus ciudadanos!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.childg: %s creció y ahora quiere un trabajo.

advancements.minecolonies.root.title: ColoniasMina
advancements.minecolonies.root.descripti: Comienza en MineColonies creando un campamento o barco de provisiones y colocándolo con clic derecho en el suelo ¡También se abrirá la pestaña de progresos de MineColonies!
advancements.minecolonies.place_townhall: ¡Ahora es el momento de comenzar con su colonia, toma la herramienta de construcción, el bloque del ayuntamiento y encuentra un área clara y agradable, haz clic derecho con la herramienta de construcción para seleccionar el estilo que desea, donde lo desea y otras cosas chulas!
advancements.minecolonies.create_build_r: ¡Genial, has creado tu colonia! Para comenzar a construir la colonia, debes crear y colocar un constructor (¡Usa la herramienta de construcción nuevamente!), contrata a un constructor (generalmente automático) y luego dile que construya su edificio.
advancements.minecolonies.click_gui_butt: ¡Ahora que le has dicho a su constructor qué hacer, consulta su pestaña de peticiones para ver qué recursos o herramientas necesita y completa una de ellas haciendo clic en el botón de completar!
advancements.minecolonies.citizen_eat_fo: ¡Los ciudadanos, como tú, necesitan comer para poder trabajar, pon algo de comida en el inventario de tu ciudadano y comerá cuando lo necesite!
advancements.minecolonies.building_add_r: Si eres como nosotros, probablemente te cansarás de tener que fabricar todo para tus trabajadores ¡Puedes enseñarle a tu constructor recetas de 2x2 y después podrías mostrarle cómo se fabrica una antorcha!
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Desarrollando el constructor
¡Asegúrate de mantener a tu constructor alimentado y de completar sus peticiones, debería comenzar y terminar de construir tu primera choza!
advancements.minecolonies.citizen_eat_fo: Pero qué clase de líder eres ¿Alimentando a tus aldeanos con carne podrida? ¡Vergüenza, vergüenza, vergüenza!
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Desarrolla al leñador

¡Ahora que tienes ese increíble Constructor, querrás comenzar a recolectar madera para crear más cabañas! Completa la construcción de una cabaña de leñadores (¡no olvides usar tu herramienta de construcción para colocarlas!)
Desarrolla el minero

No hay duda de que deseas tener unos buenos y preciosos minerales o roca para poder crear y construir cosas, completa la construcción de una choza de minero (¡una vez más, no olvides usar tu herramienta de construcción!),
Crea protección
Una vez que llegues a 5 ciudadanos en tu colonia otros pueden percatarse de su crecimiento ¡Asegúrate de construir y contratar un guardia para protegerte contra estas criaturas!
Construye una granja

Para tener una buena producción de alimentos para tus ciudadanos necesitarás construir una granja de trigo. También tendrás que colocar un bloque de campo una vez que tengas a tu agricultor para marcarle dónde debe cultivar.
Hogar dulce hogar
¡Tus ciudadanos necesitan un lugar para vivir! Constrúyeles una casa, cada nivel otorga capacidad para otro ciudadano.
Asentamiento solitario
Tus ciudadanos necesitan un techo, construye una taberna para alojarlos y para poder reclutar más.
La pieza central

Una vez que hayas configurado bien tu ciudad con un buen flujo de recursos, es posible que pienses en construir tu ayuntamiento, actualmente solo hay un par de beneficios ¡Pero es una pieza central genial!
advancements.minecolonies.colony_populat: ¡Necesitarás obtener más ciudadanos si quieres hacer mas cosas! Los niños nacerán cuando dos ciudadanos del sexo opuesto estén en la misma casa durante la noche ¡Los niños deberán ser alimentados y también necesitan dormir bien para crecer!
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Almacenamiento

Estoy seguro de que en este momento deseas comenzar a automatizar las cosas ¿Verdad? ¡Bueno, primero tenemos que colocar y construir un Almacén para almacenar todas esas golosinas que estamos obteniendo en una ubicación central!
Solicitando artículos,

Ahora que tenemos una buena ubicación para el almacenamiento centralizado ¡Comencemos a responder automáticamente a las peticiones de los ciudadanos! Construya una choza de repartidor para que responda a las solicitudes de los trabajadores.
¡Elaborando madera!,

Con el repartidor junto a ti ¡Ahora puedes comenzar a usar trabajadores de artesanía! ¡Recomendamos comenzar con la carpintería, coloca y construye una para comenzar con tu nueva experiencia de creación!
advancements.minecolonies.building_add_r: Ahora que ha desbloqueado la fabricación de 3x3 con la carpintería ¡Enséñales a cómo crear una puerta! Nota: Los artesanos solo crearán las solicitudes y tienen un límite de lo que pueden crear, consulta la pestaña de información en su choza para obtener más información.
advancements.minecolonies.complete_build: Menudo albañil
Una choza de albañil puede crear recetas 3x3 usando piedra como ingrediente principal ¡Construye una para aprovechar su habilidad!
¡Funde ese mineral!
Los trabajadores de la fundición son bastante impresionantes ¡Fundirán los minerales por tí! Y, a niveles más altos, pueden volverse bastante eficientes....
La cosa se pone caliente
Para que tu albañil haga ladrillos de piedra y cosas así, necesitará algo de piedra ¡Coloque y construya una fundición de piedra para automatizar la creación de ese recurso y mucho más!
Hornéalo
Tus ciudadanos necesitan algunos carbohidratos en sus vidas ¡Construye un panadero para crear pan automáticamente para ellos!
Buena y vieja herrería
La mayoría de los ciudadanos necesitan algún tipo de herramienta, y crearlos puede ser un proceso muy especializado ¡Construye la herrería para permitir la creación de esas herramientas!
Creando un ejército
Si realmente quieres proteger tu colonia, necesitarás muchos más guardias ¡Construir un cuartel te permitirá contratar muchos más en un espacio mucho más pequeño!
Torres bonitas

Ahora que tienes tus cuarteles, debes construir las torres de cuarteles de su interior ¡Estas torres están limitadas al mismo nivel que los cuarteles y aumentarán su capacidad de guardias en cada nivel!
Un gallinón de carne
Los pollos pueden ser ruidosos ¡Pero también son sabrosos! Construye una pollería para obtener unos buenos muslos de pollo ¡No olvides entregar algunas gallinas en su corral!
Tomando clases de caballería

Si realmente quieres proteger a tus ciudadanos, necesitarás caballeros bien entrenados ¡Construye una academia militar y asigna un ciudadano para aumentar su niveles sin que corran el riesgo de perder la vida!
Tierras fértiles
Un compostador tomará tus desperdicios vegetales tales como árboles jóvenes, hojas y elementos similares y los expondrá a los elementos ¡Esto producirá fertilizante para sus cultivos!
Alimentando a las masas
La construcción de un restaurante le dará a sus ciudadanos un lugar donde ir a buscar comida, el cocinero cocinará las carnes necesarias y les dará alimentos a sus ciudadanos ¡E incluso a tí!
¡YeeeHaaa!
Contrata un vaquero para conseguir unos hermosos chuletones, recuerda que tendrás que llevar vacas a tu vaquero para que puedan ser utilizadas.
Estoy molido
¡Construir una trituradora te permitirá obtener cosas como grava a partir de roca!
Algo huele pescalicioso
Construye una choza de pescador cerca del agua para traer esos bocaditos de las aguas profundas
Mayor aprendizaje
¡Si quieres mano de obra más cualificada, es mejor que construyas una biblioteca para enseñar a tus ciudadanos!
María tenía un corderito
A veces necesitas muchísimo un poco de lana suave en tu vida ¡Construye una choza de pastor para pillar a esas pobres ovejas desprevenidas!
Diamante en bruto

com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.0:
The Builder is the heart of your colony. Without them, you wouldn't be able to get anything done!
 Every hut worker has to have their building built to at least level 1 before they can do anything, except the Builder. If the Builder has a hut at level 0 (no hut), they can only build one thing, their own hut.

 For your Builder to build, upgrade, reposition, or repair a hut that isn't their own, their hut must be at least the same level as the other hut. For example, the Builder's Hut must be level 3 or above to build a level 3 hut.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.1:
Let's cover builder restrictions:

 1. Builders (and most other workers) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Builders have a maximum range of 100 blocks for buildings for automatic assignment. If your building is outside that range, in the top right of the build options GUI (for the hut you want to be built) you can select which Builder to assign to that building.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. I'm seeing an item in the required resources page that seems unobtainable or requires Silk Touch to get. What should I do?
   A 1. Things like Air, Dirt Paths, and other blocks will show up in the required resources tab from time to time. While they do show up, focus mainly on your Builder's personal request tab. They'll usually request the correct block and convert it accordingly (e.g. request Dirt and then use a shovel on it).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.3:
As all workers do, the Builder levels up while working.
 With higher levels, the Builder's speed increases. The higher their hut level, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.0: The Citizen Hut is where your citizens will live. For every level of the Citizen Hut the building will house one citizen. You will need multiple houses to house everyone. The only citizens that will not live in a Citizen Hut are your Guards.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.1: In order to have children, a male and a female citizen must be housed together in one Citizen Hut. Even if you don't have room in the same hut as them, as long as there is an open bed in any hut within the colony, a child can be born. If there is an adult in another house, the child will be adopted by them, taking on the last name of that adult. If there is a hut with no adult in it, the child will get a random name.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.2: Workers have their level capped by the level of their Citizen Hut. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.0: The Miner is one of the production workers for your colony. They will need an pickaxe to mine stone, a shovel to mine dirt and gravel, and sometimes even an axe if they run into a mineshaft. They will also need supplies to build their own mineshafts, such as blocks, slabs, fences/walls, signs, ladders, and torches.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.1:
Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Miners unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How far down will my miner dig before making nodes?
   A 1. Without intervention, at level 1 they will build nodes after they hit y level 50, at level 2 they will make nodes after they hit y level 30, and at level 3 they will make nodes after they hit y level 5.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.3:
Q2. My miner just stops working or wanders around above ground, why?
  A 2. Either something is blocking their path or they don't have the necessary materials. See page 1 for the materials they need or check the miners request page.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.4:
As all workers do, the Miner levels up while working.
 With higher levels, the Miner's speed increases. The higher their hut level, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack:
The lumberjack is one of the production workers for your colony. Give him an axe and he'll cut down any trees around him, he'll also replant a sapling where the tree was if he has any.
 If you wish to apply restrictions on what trees he can or can't cut, take a look at the second page.
 Even cooler is the third page, here you can tell the lumberjack to not replant saplings, or you can tell him to be restricted to a certain area (selected with the tool given by the third button on the page).

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Lumberjacks unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Lumberjacks are able to search for trees within a 150 blocks of their worker (not the hut), while searching they start with a 50 block search range and then increase that range by 5 when they do not find a tree.

3. La definición de un "Árbol" en Minecraft es bastante confusa, hemos hecho todo lo posible para definir un árbol, pero en algunos casos puede no ser suficiente. En general, definimos un árbol como un tronco y hojas (dentro de una vecindad cercana), debido a esto, algunas de sus cabañas o decoraciones pueden verse afectadas por el leñador, para contrarrestar esto puede colocar un bloque de roca debajo de un tronco para marcarlo como "No es un árbol".

As all workers the lumberjack levels up while chopping trees.
 Similar to the builder, with higher levels their speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The warehouse is part of colony management. Where all of your excess supplies are stored. There are no workers assigned to the warehouse, but the deliverymen use the warehouse.

Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Space is limited to the number of racks in the schematic, you can not add your own, if you do, they will get destroyed when the building is updated and the deliverymen will not see those racks or use them. You can not move the racks in the building, if you break a rack, it is no longer seen by the deliverymen.

3. Now let's cover some frequently asked questions: 

 Q 1. I need more storage space then is given, how do I get more? 
 A 1. Upgrade the building, if the building is level 5, you can increase the space in each rack by upgrading on page 2 using an emerald block. This can be done 3 times.

Q 2. I want to move my warehouse, can I do that? 
 A 2. You can, but if there is anything in the racks, the contents will spill out when the racks are removed by the builder. If you must move the warehouse, remove all the contents from the racks first, and watch to make sure any deliverymen don't deliver items.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryma: The delivermen are part of colony management. They are the transportation service of the colony, they will pick up unneeded items from workers huts and drop them at the warehouse, or gathering needed items from the warehouse and deliver them to workers.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 The amount of items the deliveryman can carry depends on his hut level. 
 Level 1: 1 Stack 
 Level 2: 2 Stacks 
 Level 3: 4 Stacks 
 Level 4: 8 Stacks 
 Level 5: unlimited

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How do I change the priority of who the deliverymen pickup from?
   A 1. In each hut, there is a Pickup priority setting, it can be set to automatic (auto set), manual (you change the setting at the bottom 1 is lowest, 10 is highest, or never (no items will ever be picked up.

 Q 2. Can I can the delivery priority?
 A 2. No, the delivery schedule is determined by order the request is sent.

As all workers the deliveryman levels up while delivering and picking up items.
 With higher levels the deliverymen's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.0:
The cook is part of the food production line of your colony. The cook supplies all your citizens with food and will cook meat and potatoes. (Or other cooked food that only needs a furnace.)
 When a citizen gets hungry, they will go to the cook to get something to eat.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.1: The cook can not make any food with items that are not consumed in the making such as pots and pans (these are usually from other mods such as Pam's).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. The cook is asking for items that are already cooked, is this normal?
   A 1. You can provide pre-made items to the cook for them to distribute to your colonists.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.3:
As all workers the cook levels up while working.
 With higher levels the cook's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.0: The baker is part of the food production line of your colony. They will bake break, cookies, pumpkin pie and cake. On page two of the GUI, you can select which items you want them to make.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.1: The baker can not make any food with items that are not consumed in the making such as pots and pans (these are usually from other mods such as Pam's).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My baker is using more items than they are producing, why?
   A 1. The baker may be consuming some product when they get hungry. Also, while the wheat may not be visible, the product may still be in the process of being produced.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.3:
As all workers the baker levels up while working.
 With higher levels the baker's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.0: The farmer is part of the food production line of your colony. The farmer grows the food for the colony. The farmer can plant and harvest any food item that is planted in farm land soil, even from other mods.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.1:
Farmers (and most workers in general) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Farmers can not grow plants that do not use farm land, such as sugar cane, cactus, or bamboo. 
 Farmers can only mantain one field per hut level.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. I want a smaller field, how do I tell my farmer not to grow foods to the maximum size, how do I do this? 
   A 1. Place cobble around the area you want the farmer to grow plants.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.3:
As all workers the farmer levels up while working.
 With higher levels the farmer speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The fisherman is part of the food production line of your colony. Simply put, the fisherman will fish as long as you provide them with a fishing pole.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. The fisherman needs a body of water at least seven blocks by seven blocks and at least one block deep. The hut block must be at ground level with the water and must be <= ten blocks from the water.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My fisherman is catching more than just fish, why?
   A 1. The fishermen can catch other items from the water, same as the player.

As all workers the fisherman levels up while working.
 With higher levels the fisherman's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.chickenher: The chickenherder is part of the food production line. The chickenherder breeds, raises, and butchers chickens for your colony. They will also collect eggs and feathers. The chickenherder can have two chickens per level of the hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Chickenherders (and most workers in general) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two chickens must be provided to the chickenherder for them to start breeding and butchering them.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my chickenherder need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two chickens to get things started. The herder also needs seeds to breed the chickens and an axe to butcher them.

As all workers the chickenherder levels up while working.
 With higher levels the chickenherder's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.swineherde: The swineherder is part of the food production line. The swineherder breeds, raises, and butchers pigs for your colony. The swineherder can have two pigs per level of the hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Swineherders (and most workers in general) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two pigs must be provided to the swineherder for them to start breeding and butchering them.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my swineherder need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two pigs to get things started. The herder also needs carrots to breed the pigs and an axe to butcher them.

As all workers the swineherder levels up while working.
 With higher levels the swineherder's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.0: The shepherd is part of the food production line. The shepherd breeds, raises, and butchers sheep for your colony. The shepherd can have two sheep per level of the hut. The shepherd will also shear sheep for wool. And if you choose, on the second page of the GUI you can also tell the shepher to randomly dye sheep for colored wool.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Shepherds (and most workers in general) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two sheep must be provided to the shepherd for them to start breeding and butchering them.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my shepherd need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two sheep to get things started. The herder also needs wheat to breed the sheep, shears to remove the wool, and an axe to butcher them.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.3:
As all workers the shepherd levels up while working.
 With higher levels the shepherd's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.0: The cowboy is part of the food production line. The cowboy breeds, raises, and butchers cows for your colony. The cowboy can have two cows per level of the hut.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Cowboys (and most workers in general) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two cows must be provided to the cowboy for them to start breeding and butchering them.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my cowboy need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two cows to get things started. The herder also needs wheat to breed the cows and an axe to butcher them.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.3:
As all workers the cowboy levels up while working.
 With higher levels the cowboy's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The composter is part of the crafting line of your colony. The composter will take items that you choose for them to use, to make compost for your farmer and florist to use.

Now let's cover composter restrictions:

 1. You must choose which items you want the composter to use to make compost with. This is found on page two of the GUI. 
   Be careful using food items if you have a large colony but not many food production huts.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I use items from other mods?
   A 1. Yes, these must be added in the configuration file for Minecolonies found in your game's config file ../config/minecolonies-common.toml

As all workers the composter levels up while working.
 With higher levels the composter's speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.guardtower: The guard tower is the basic hut for your military defense. Each guard tower houses one guard. However, the guard will also live here so it frees up a bed in the citizen huts for more citizens.

Now let's cover guard tower restrictions:

 1. Guards (and most workers in general) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

2. The guards will only patrol a certain area depending on their hut level: 
   lvl 1. 80 Blocks
   lvl 2. 110 Blocks
   lvl 3. 140 Blocks
   lvl 4. 170 Blocks 
   lvl 5. 200 Blocks
   However, they will stay inside the colony border.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My guards towers have been leveled up but the guards aren't asking for higher level equipment, why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers the guards levels up while working.
 With higher levels the guards speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracksto: The barracks tower is the heart of your military defense. Each barracks tower houses five guards, one for every level of the hut. However, the guard will also live here so it frees up a bed in the citizen huts for more citizens.

Now let's cover barracks tower restrictions:

 1. Guards (and most workers in general) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

2. The guards will only patrol a certain area depending on their hut level: 
   lvl 1. 80 Blocks
   lvl 2. 110 Blocks
   lvl 3. 140 Blocks
   lvl 4. 170 Blocks 
   lvl 5. 200 Blocks
   However, they will stay inside the colony border.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My guards towers have been leveled up but the guards aren't asking for higher level equipment, why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers the guards levels up while working.
 With higher levels the guards speed increases. The higher the hut level is the quicker they level up.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.0:
The barracks is the heart of your military defense, without it you wouldn't be able to build any barracks towers.
 Each barracks contain four barracks towers, one for each level up to level four.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.1:
Now let's cover barracks restrictions:

 1. Barracks only hold 1 tower per level, and each tower can only level as high as the barracks. So if you have a level one barracks, it will only allow for one barracks tower and it's max level is one. If you have a level three barracks, it will allow for three barracks towers and their max level is three.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I have more than one barracks?
   A 1. Yes, but the tower levels are based on the barracks they are attached to. So even if you have one barracks that is level 5, if the second barracks is only level one, then that barracks can only have a single level one tower.

comes from a cold place up north. In hope to find something warmer %s stopped by your tavern.
is not a fan of this place, but didnt see any other closeby.
likes to wander around the world. Wandering makes hungry and thirsty, so %s stopped by your tavern.
is not the  tallest one, but firmly believes that even the smallest person can change the course of the future.
saw a village with its inhabitants going around in minecarts. It seemed like fun and maybe %s can do that here too.
travels around a lot, a stranger once said 'Chewie, we're home.', %s couldnt make much sense of it though
is rather weird, anytime you pass by %s utters 'Live long, and prosper'.
was a rich travelling trader until someone robbed %s of all the goods.
was known as a strong fighter in a far away kingdom, though for some reason %s cannot go back there.
has excellent masonry skills, but %s's father wanted a cow herder.
is a noble from a distant town. %s thinks to surely become the major of this tiny town soon
waves with the hand and mumbles something like tree force bee wich you
has seen many towns, but none as beautiful as this.
comes from a neighbouring town where %s worked as wood cutter.
is from a place where the old, dusty books live. But after living so long in between these books, %s needed to see other people.
always wanted to build houses. Big houses, tiny houses, building with wingardium leviosa - but that doesnt seem to work at as the travelling sorcerer said, so %s is now resting at your tavern.
is an avid guard and while fighting against hordes of zombies, skeletons and those weird endermen, %s heard about a colony which could use a little help against raiders.
is a treasure hunter. But digging in someone elses trash in search for some gold or iron is very tiring. Now %s looks for another task.
seems adapt at using swords and says 'if by my life or death I can protect you, I will. You have my sword'
